content: There's no critical issues, regressions, etc. for @T-libs to handle today. How about we use today's meeting to go a bit into the details of some implementation improvements we discussed during our brainstorm recently? Specifically, we could talk about 1) fmt::Arguments (more relevant because of Rust 2021, see here]), 2) mutexes without allocations (without libc/pthread), and/or 3) how to allow out-of-tree platform/os support for lesser known platforms.
for the @T-libs meeting, i'll use the time before the meeting to prepare some overview of the experiments i've done so far to improve fmt::Arguments. plenty of things to talk about probably :)
@T-libs Meeting time! agenda/notes: https://hackmd.io/X2hMc1IKReCYG7eRFslUNg jitsi: https://meet.jit.si/rust-libs-meeting-ujepnbwg2lzqgt6wvrndwimi
@T-libs can i get some feedback on the style of meeting we had today? should we do this type of deep-dives more often?
i think i have a few more topics i could talk about, but i'm very interested to hear if any of you have anything you'd want to dive into
